page.title: 18Block Geography Class 7
page.content: Major part of survey area is rural, the western 1/3 being occupied by urban expansion of Blackpool inc Zoo & Stanley Park. Continual infilling of housing in Normoss/Hardhorn whilst pop. of Staining has increased 5 fold >1960s Little industry in Staining, so kept village character. Few amenities in village- school enlarged to take increase in children. 1950-50children 1970s- 286(max) 1985- 213 but rising. Total area very flat part marshland- large area water called Marton Mere. Agriculture- dairy with some other animals. Main crops are hay & silage, corn, some potatoes and horticulture. Apart from housing development the land has remained largely unchanged for 50y. Major change will be building of link road from Fleetwood to end of M55 which will cut a N/S swathe through the block.This is still under discussion.
